newsitem.title: USA: Voters reject Georgetown Cty, S.C., school bonds.
newsitem.headline: Voters reject Georgetown Cty, S.C., school bonds.

text.p: Voters in South Carolina's Georgetown County rejected a $107.5 million general obligation bond issue for schools by a 2-1 margin, elections officials said.
The measure failed with 4,303 no votes and 1,705 no votes in Tuesday's referendum.
The proposal would have financed construction of five new schools and renovations at existing schools, enabling the county to eliminate the use of portable classrooms.

A $108.8 million GO referndum for schools also failed, by a narrow margin. A second bond proposal last year was scrapped after the U.S. Justice Department said it would not adequately address desegregation issues.
With the failure of the latest bond proposal, the county school board must draft a new proposal to meet the Justice Department's requiremet that it better integrate its schools.
